we have an on campus department who drive around 24/7 to make sure all students are safe.
a lot of things to be involved in.
fit people. smart people.
massey hall is located in the middle of nowhere. you walk through a forest and emerge to a giant building.
the university is expensive because it's a private college, but they give out really good grants and scholarships.
open mic nights every thursday. movies played almost every friday night in romos. random on campus activities and sports events. nevell island, where you can ice skate and stuff.
the food on campus is pretty good. my only problem is i wish there was more options, like an on campus diner or something.
the dorms are decent, but could be cleaner. the bathrooms are another story.
so far, my classes have been challenging but not so hard that i get lost when learning.
if you are a nursing major, come here. the program is one of the best in the state. bring sneakers because you have a lot of hills to walk up and down all over campus.

rmu is a private university that helps each student fulfill their full potential. the classes are small, making it easy to get to know your professors. the campus is not too big as well, making it easy to get to any class in a matter of five minutes.

textAfterTable: Academic Rigor My experience may be slightly swayed because I'm a media arts student and my first semester included a communication skills course, a math course, intro to psychology, and an art and a video course. So, the communication skills class was the only traditionally rigorous course (assignments and papers), while the art courses were a drawing per week or the production elements of a project. But, from my experience in my first week of my second semester, I'm seeing that this will be a more rigorous set or courses for me. So, it varies but overall the work can be a challenge, but I don't believe it could ever bury you. And in any such case, we offer free tutoring services. Tips for prospective students Really get involved if you come to RMU - we have a lot of opportunity to be involved in the theatre, tv station, and radio, as well as the newspaper and literary journal. Also, there's a club or organization to suit virtually everyone. In three sentences The courses are not too easy or too strenuous, and the teachers I have had are helpful but do not baby their students by any stretch. The campus is beautiful and easy to navigate, and the residence halls and campus facilities are great. Overall, I love RMU.
